meanings.sent1: The teacher endorses the student's hard work in class.
meanings.sent2: The community endorses the new recycling program.
meanings.sent3: The cat endorses the idea of more treats for everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her smile endorses the joy of the occasion.

meanings.definition: To give one's public approval or support
meanings.sent1: The mayor endorses the upcoming charity event.
meanings.sent2: The celebrity endorses the new fashion line.
meanings.sent3: The clown endorses the idea of silliness for a good cause.
meanings.sent4: His laughter endorses the comedy show's success.
meanings.sent5: The banner endorses the message of unity and peace.

meanings.definition: To sign one's name on the back of a check or other document to authorize its payment or validity
meanings.sent1: Please endorse the check before depositing it in the bank.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer endorses the legal document with her signature.
meanings.sent3: The pirate endorses the treasure map with an 'X' marks the spot.
meanings.sent4: His signature endorses the contract's terms and conditions.
meanings.sent5: The stamp endorses the letter for mailing.
